title: Taiwanese Hokkien
summary: Taiwanese,[upper-roman 2] also known as Taigi,[upper-roman 1][8] Taiwanese Hokkien (/ˈhɒkiɛn, hɒˈkiːɛn/),[lower-alpha 2] Taiwanese Minnan, Hoklo and Holo,[9][10] is a variety of the Hokkien language spoken natively by about 70% of the population of Taiwan.[11] It is spoken by the Taiwanese Hoklo people, who descended from immigrants from southern Fujian during the Qing dynasty.[12] The Pe̍h-ōe-jī (POJ) romanization is a popular orthography for Taiwanese.
